title: How to Make Coconut Ice Square

steps.headline: Sift the flour and baking powder together.
steps.description: Mix the cocoa, sugar, and coconut together. Combine both.

steps.headline: Rub in the butter until fine crumbs form.
Press the dough that forms into a baking paper lined baking tray.
Place in the oven and bake for 15 - 20 minutes.
steps.description: The key is to watch for it rising. Do not let it dry out.

steps.headline: Make the topping while the base bakes.
steps.description: Melt the butter in a small saucepan filled with the milk. Add the sugar and stir until it dissolves, for about 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the coconut and vanilla essence.
steps.description: Whisk until the mixture turns thick and white and quickly pour the topping over the baked base. Smooth out as required.

steps.headline: Leave to set.
steps.description: Cut into finger shapes when still slightly warm but the topping has set.

text: Preheat the oven to 375ºF.  Sift the flour and baking powder together. Mix the cocoa, sugar, and coconut together. Combine both. Rub in the butter until fine crumbs form.  Press the dough that forms into a baking paper lined baking tray. Even out. Place in the oven and bake for 15 - 20 minutes. The key is to watch for it rising. Do not let it dry out. Make the topping while the base bakes. Melt the butter in a small saucepan filled with the milk. Add the sugar and stir until it dissolves, for about 3 minutes. Add the coconut and vanilla essence. Whisk until the mixture turns thick and white and quickly pour the topping over the baked base. Smooth out as required. Leave to set. Cut into finger shapes when still slightly warm but the topping has set. Finished.
